result.execSummary:
The defendant Rachelann M. Pershing was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: with huber privileges.  Court leaves use of EMP up to jail.

miscConds.notes: FTE/schooling or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week.

DNA sample.  

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed necessary by Department. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rachelann M. Pershing

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letters of character of defendant.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 8:36 am 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person with Atty James Kurszewski. 
Argument re: conditional jail time. 
Deft makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT ORDERS: In 15CF64, On Ct. 1>> 9 months MCJ imposed and STAYED for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed necessary by dept; absolute sobriety; fulltime employment/schooling or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; drug screening as required; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds the deft is entitled to 102 days jail credit if revoked. 
COURT notes if served, jail maybe be with huber privileges and COURT leaves use of EMP up to jail. 
Adj: 8:55 am
Sentencing hearing on September 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:13 pm 
INCLUDES 15CF64 AND 15CM107. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person with Atty James Kurszewski.   
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
In 15CM107: Ct. 1 (Retail Theft/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: In 15CF64: Ct. 1 (Deliver Non-Narcotics/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT directs parties to see JA to set sentencing hearing. 
Bond continues.

records.addlTxt: INCLUDES 15CM107 & 15CF64 Absolute sobriety or unless valid prescription for meds. Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 for Day report.   No contact with victim(s): Shopko on 18th Ave. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.
